intro: Gouania discolor var. ulei, commonly known as the Brazilian nettle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories. It has a hairy texture and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its stinging hairs, it can cause skin irritation upon contact.
